snippet: The move will increase money for schools and libraries to connect to the Internet.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission increases financing for high-speed Internet programs for libraries and schools; E-Rate program will grow by $1.5 billion to spending cap of $3.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The move will increase money for schools and libraries to connect to the Internet.

headline.main: F.C.C. Increases Money for E-Rate Program for Internet in Schools and Libraries
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Increases Financing for Internet Programs for Education
